html:
Role Voice type Premiere cast
11 March 1867[53][54]
(Conductor:
François George-Hainl) 		Revised version
Premiere cast
10 January 1884[53]
(Conductor: Franco Faccio)[55]
Philippe II (Filippo II / Philip II), the King of Spain, son of Charles V and father of Don Carlos bass
Don Carlos (Don Carlo), Infante of Spain, son and heir to the King tenor
Rodrigue (Rodrigo), Marquis of Posa, a friend of the Infante Don Carlos baritone
Le Grand Inquisiteur (The Grand Inquisitor)[56] bass
Élisabeth de Valois (Elisabeth of Valois), a French princess initially betrothed to Don Carlos but then married to King Philip soprano
Princess Eboli, an aristocrat in court mezzo-soprano
A monk, who at the end of Act 5 appears as Charles-Quint (Emperor Charles V), thought to be dead[57] bass
Thibault (Tebaldo), page to Elisabeth soprano (en travesti)
A Voice from Heaven soprano
The Count of Lerma, a Spanish delegate to France tenor
Royal Herald tenor
Countess of Aremberg, a lady-in-waiting to Elisabeth silent
Flemish envoys, Inquisitors, Ladies and Gentlemen of the Spanish Court, the people, Pages, Guards, Monks, Soldiers – chorus
